intro: Aspicarpa mollis, commonly known as the silky ant plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Aspicarpa mollis is notable for its ability to attract various insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
